intro: Ischyrolepis caespitosa, commonly known as the tufted spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. Its leaves are usually covered in a fine layer of white or pale-colored hairs, which help reduce water loss. The plant is part of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its diverse and often toxic species.
